definition: harm/troubles/CL:個|个[ge4]
bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish

sentences.english: To not follow the truly humane will bring immeasurable harm.
sentences.chinese: 要是不親熱有仁德的人，那將帶給咱們如許大的壞處。

sentences.english: And as I say,I don't in any way want to belittle the central badness of that.
sentences.chinese: 我說過我並不想貶低其主要壞處。

sentences.english: And the first question we're going to be focusing on is just this, the question of the badness of death.
sentences.chinese: 我們第一個要研究的問題就是，死亡的壞處。

sentences.english: She finished the breakfast and hurried up to go to work…
sentences.chinese: 跑完步接着去喫早飯對身體有什麼壞處嗎？

sentences.english: All right. So I've been talking for, actually now a couple of weeks I suppose, about the central badness of death.
sentences.chinese: 好了，我已經談了，幾個星期，關於死亡的壞處。

sentences.english: Wore invisible glasses wears sunglasses again, does cross-eye eyeball have disadvantage?
sentences.chinese: 戴了隱形眼鏡再戴墨鏡，對眼睛有壞處嗎？

sentences.english: Tune in tomorrow for her Top 10 Cons of Virginity
sentences.chinese: 文字筆調上接她的《童貞的十大壞處》。

sentences.english: The downside of fiscal stimulus is that someone must pay for it.
sentences.chinese: 財政刺激方案的唯一壞處就是總得有人買單。

sentences.english: When I read about the evils of drinking...I gave up reading.
sentences.chinese: 每當我讀到喝酒的壞處時，我就戒掉閱讀。

sentences.english: We have to think about how is it,how could it be true, that death is bad for the person that dies?
sentences.chinese: 我們需要想清楚爲什麼死亡，會對死者本身造成壞處？

sentences.english: Jack couldn't, however, see any harm in spelunking down for a closer look.
sentences.chinese: 傑克則認爲，下去探探洞穴，應該沒什麼壞處。

sentences.english: Could you tell us about some of the good and bad things about living with a roommate?
sentences.chinese: 你能說說跟室友同住的好處和壞處嗎？

sentences.english: After all, when is a headache bad for me?
sentences.chinese: 畢竟，什麼時候頭疼對我來說有壞處？

sentences.english: It would not hurt if you have been prepared.
It had the disadvantage, however, of looking truly hideous.
sentences.chinese: 不過壞處也是有的，也就是，看起來特別的醜。

sentences.english: Does excuse me summer wear glasses cross - eye eyeball to do not have disadvantage again?
sentences.chinese: 請問夏天戴眼鏡對眼睛又沒有壞處？

definition: benefit/advantage/gain/profit/also pr. [hao3 chu4]/CL:個|个[ge4]
merit/benefit/strong point/advantage/CL:個|个[ge4],項|项[xiang4]
weak point/fault/shortcoming/disadvantage/CL:個|个[ge4]
character acquired through long habit/habits and properties
hesitancy/indecision/to waver
varying from person to person (idiom); different for each individual
conversely/in reverse order/in an opposite direction
to haggle over every ounce/(fig.) to fuss over minor matters/to split hairs
attitude (of the heart)/state of one's psyche/way of thinking/mentality
not necessarily/not likely
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
good aspects/strong points
hopelessly muddled/impossible to unravel
bad habit/vice
bad habit (e.g. nose-picking)/petty maneuver/dirty trick/gamesmanship
a modal particle indicating (don't mind it, ok)
a modal particle indicating (that's all, only, nothing much)
